Benefits
In addition to a competitive salary, we also offer a generous pension scheme and to support your well-being we provide health insurance, life cover and an employee assistance programme.

Our centrally located Bristol office provides a well-stocked kitchen with healthy food, drinks and snacks and our very own barista! We have an active social scene too - from cycling, yoga, running and football right through to a board game group.

We welcome people of different backgrounds and experiences and are committed to building an inclusive work environment that makes Graphcore a great home for everyone. We are an equal opportunity employer and want to build a work environment where everyone is happy, productive and respectful. If you have a disability or additional need that requires accommodation, just let us know.

Please note, we are only considering candidates who have an established right to work in the UK for roles based in Bristol, UK.

Why join Moneysupermarket Group?


Having recently refurbished our, multimillion-pound office in Ewloe, Moneysupermarket has gone through a period of transformation after investing £60M over the last 3 years to modernise our platform. We supply products from over 800 financial providers to more than 24 million unique monthly visitors, helping UK households save over £2 billion in 2019. But our users demand more, so we are constantly changing our platform and products to help customers save money and deliver the experience they love.

We have an exciting opportunity for a DevOps Engineer to work in Ewloe alongside our Product Engineering teams ensuring they succeed in their goal of rapid development and release of high-quality services.

What we mean by DevOps:


Yep. We have DevOps in our job titles but it's not just useful for job adverts. Our Product Engineering teams rely on the work of infrastructure, automation, operations and system integration specialists to help them own and deploy their services as simply, quickly and as safely as possible. As a DevOps Engineer at Moneysupermarket, you will engineer DevOps to occur.

About you:


We are looking for someone that shares our passion to provide our customers with exceptional customer service and is keen to progress and react rapidly within a fast-paced, service-orientated environment. You should have the ability to maintain effective working relationships, communicate clearly and actively contribute to the team and its development. You should show dedication and commitment to ensure work is completed within timescales and exhibit a high level of initiative at all times by thinking outside of the box and not be afraid to take risks.

What you will do:
Enable the delivery of maintainable and reliable web services that improve the lives of our customers and colleagues alike
Create new patterns and promote best practice enabling your Product Engineering colleagues to be self-sufficient
Consult with the Development community and continuously improve the build and deployment process
Optimise the insight and observability that a Product Engineering team has into their services and act on that feedback
Contribute to an ever more secure and robust Delivery Platform and ensure good software engineering practice underpins it
Develop and inform our colleagues across the business and help shape our engineering culture
What we will do:

Align your goals with our purpose of saving the UK public billions of pounds every year
Maintain a clear vision of our tech future that is built from the people who use it
Provide an open and safe working environment
Give you the space and autonomy to develop your own solutions
Broaden and deepen your skills through self-selected study, group innovation time and on-the-job coaching
Keep you and yours happy and healthy through our colleague support options
What tech skills you will need to excel in this role:
Linux (any distro)
Configuration management /(Terraform)|(Helm)|(Puppet)/
Containers and container management /(Kubernetes)/
CI/CD tooling /(Jenkins)|(Code*)|(GitOps)/
AWS /(EC2)|(VPC)|(Lambda)/
Code /(Ruby)|(Python)|(Golang)/
Build and test tools
Monitoring tools /(Prometheus)|(Sensu)|(Grafana)/
Network routing and security
Software security
Databases
Comfortable in an Agile product engineering environment
CRITICAL: An ability and eagerness to learn what you don't know today
All Benefits can be found on the Moneysupermarket Group Careers website


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on age, sex, race, religion, pregnancy and maternity, disability, and sexual orientation. Please be aware that, if youre successful in securing this position, the offer will be subject to several colleague checks that may include: identity, right to work in the UK, credit, criminal record and references.

A World-Changing Company

At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.

The Role

Forward Deployed Software Engineers (FDSEs) understand our customers’ greatest pain points and design end-to-end solutions to address them. FDSEs solicit constant feedback on their work from both customers and colleagues, improving our products over time with rapid iteration cycles.

FDSEs deploy ground breaking technical solutions to solve our customers’ hardest problems. Projects often start with a nebulous question like “Why are we losing customers?” or “How can we more effectively identify instances of money laundering?” FDSEs lead the way in developing a solution, from high-level system design and prototyping to application development and data integration. As an FDSE, you leverage everything around you: Palantir products, open source technologies, and anything you and your team can build to drive real impact.

You work with customers around the globe, where you gain rare insight into the world’s most important industries and institutions. We help our customers detect insider trading, improve disaster relief, fight healthcare fraud, and more. Each mission presents different challenges, from the regulatory environment to the nature of the data to the user population. You will work to accommodate all aspects of an environment to drive real technical outcomes for our customers.
Technologies We Use
Core Palantir products provide the foundations for our deployments.
Custom applications built on top of core Palantir platforms.
Postgres, Cassandra, Hadoop, and Spark for distributed data storage and parallel computing.
Java and Groovy for our back-end applications and data integration tools.
Typescript, React, Leaflet, and d3 for our web technologies.
Python for data processing and analysis.
Palantir cloud infrastructure based on AWS EC2 and S3.
Our Principles
Impact: We take on meaningful and challenging projects that change the world for the better.
Dedication: We see projects through from beginning to end in spite of obstacles we may encounter.
Collaboration: We work internally with people from a variety of backgrounds — such as other FDSEs, product teams, and Deployment Strategists. We also work externally with our customers, often on site, to understand and solve their problems.
Trust: We trust each other to effectively manage time and priorities—we don't micromanage. We want to give people the space to think for themselves.
Growth: We push ourselves and our peers to improve themselves and the world around them.
Learning: We often face entirely novel problems, where we need to pick up a lot of new information and learn how to use it to make progress.
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in fields such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Software Engineering, Physics or relevant experience.
Familiarity with data structures, storage systems, cloud infrastructure, front-end frameworks, and other technical tools.
Understanding of how technical decisions impact the user of what you’re building.
Proficiency with programming languages such as Java, C++, Python, JavaScript, or similar languages.
Ability to work effectively in teams of technical and non-technical individuals.
Skill and comfort working in a rapidly changing environment with dynamic objectives and iteration with users.
Demonstrated ability to continuously learn, work independently, and make decisions with minimal supervision.
Willingness and interest to travel as needed.
If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations@palantir.com.

At Zoopla we want to help everyone make intelligent home buying decisions. We are building a team that will have the once in a career opportunity to re-imagine our industry.

The interesting stuff…
You will have spent lots of quality time with your IDE of choice, deeply learning the powerful idioms and important idiosyncrasies of multiple programming languages and their ecosystems. We like to code mostly in Golang, Python, Node.js / JavaScript, .NET Core and Perl here, but we’re open to all.
You will ideally know AWS as well as you know your best friend, although it’s great if you’re good friends with other cloud services, too.
You will have diligently practiced your engineering craft, mastering your skills in techniques such as TDD, refactoring, clean code and pair programming.
You will have implemented CI pipelines and automation, championed the quality and deployment benefits of both to others.
The product(s) you’ve built will have delighted users (perhaps millions of them!) while being stable, performant, observable and supportable.
If you’ve played a role in designing and implementing new architectures and technical strategies, while also looking after existing technology real estate, you’ll fit in great.
Importantly, if you’re looking for a senior role with us, you will have achieved many of the things above while also teaching others, influencing your team and organisation, and maybe even sharing your journey and knowledge publicly.
Why Zoopla…
We're serious about tech but we don't take ourselves too seriously.
We are spiritually agile, not religiously agile.
We strongly believe in the value of good design. We believe it is a primary differentiator in an increasingly crowded marketplace.
We believe in the value of data. We run a team that is data informed. We think being data-driven is soulless and dangerous. Clean, confident, clear data combined with the insights of the team is what drives our decisions.
We want to build small, collaborative, cross-functional teams that push each other to create elegant, simple solutions to difficult customer problems.
No matter what the role we want everyone to be obsessed with getting inside the minds of our customers.
How do you know we’re the best place for you?
You strive to set the standard and are always looking to raise the bar and want to be surrounded by others who do so as well
You enjoy knowing your customer
You want to build things together, collaboratively with your team
You want to own it; to have ownership and accountability for the outcomes of your effort
You value sharing and committing to discussions and debates with your teammates
And if you want to come help us re-imagine an industry

Job Title: Managing Consultant, Software Engineering (Automation into Consumer markets)
Job Description:
Managing Consultant, Software Engineering (Automation into Consumer markets)

Apply Now

Become part of the team


Managing Consultant, Software Engineering (Automation into Consumer markets)

We are looking for innovative business leader who understands the complexities of software solutions into highly automated production environments.

We’re an innovation and transformation consultancy that believes in the power of ingenuity to build a positive-human future in a technology-driven world. Our diverse teams of experts combine innovative thinking with breakthrough-technologies to progress further, faster.

With a global network ranging from tech start-ups to Fortune 500 clients, we’ll offer you fascinating work, unrivalled opportunities for growth and the freedom to realise your potential excel. Combining strategies, technologies and innovation, we turn complexity to opportunity and deliver enduring results, enabling you to build a successful and rewarding career.

Isn’t it time you joined us?

Become part of the Team:

The Software and Controls capability at PA is a highly technical team of developers, architects and engineers assisting PA’s client base with innovation and product development across a wide variety of industry sectors. Sitting at the border of hardware and software the team uses their enviable track record of success to help clients to overcome technical hurdles and bring products to market faster through their own strength of experience in combination with PA’s other product development capabilities. Based at our technology centre in Melbourn, the 30+ strong team boasts specialists across technology stacks and industry sectors and we are looking to augment this through the hiring of a Managing Consultant with a strong background in automation.

The role of Managing Consultant (MC):

Within PA the MC role represents a top tier appointment in the organisation, with MC’s typically serving as our business development, thought and team leaders. With one foot in the operation, one foot in the strategic and a head of business and proposition development, this role is highly varied and calls for someone who is autonomous and a self-starter.

What we're looking for


The ideal candidate will have:

Sectors such as FMCG, Food and Packaging typically require high levels of automation in the production processes. We are looking for candidates who have an understanding of this space, and have experience developing software solutions in conjunction with engineers to meet the often complex and bespoke needs of these industries.

You should be able to demonstrate:
A broad understanding of software and it’s application to automation control
A flair for client management and business development
Strong project management skills with a track record of successful product development and deployment
Cross discipline understanding; you should be able to work across hardware, software, data analysis and be comfortable working with stakeholders in these disciplines
This is a senior opportunity which would suit a candidate that is looking for role that will allow them to build something by leveraging PA’s enviable technical capability into the automation/production space.

* Please note you must already have the unconditional right to live and work in the EU/UK region*

Benefits


• Private medical insurance
• Travel allowance
• 25 days annual leave with the opportunity to buy 5 additional days
• Company pension scheme
• Annual performance-based bonus
• Life and Income protection insurance
• Tax efficient benefits (cycle to work, give as you earn)
• Additional optional benefits (Dental, critical illness, spouse/partner life assurance)

About us


We believe in the power of ingenuity to build a positive human future in a technology-driven world.

As strategies, technologies and innovation collide, we create opportunity from complexity.

Our diverse teams of experts combine innovative thinking and breakthrough use of technologies to progress further, faster. Our clients adapt and transform, and together we achieve enduring results.

An innovation and transformation consultancy, we are over 3,200 specialists in consumer, defence and security, energy and utilities, financial services, government, health and life sciences, manufacturing, and transport. Our people are strategists, innovators, designers, consultants, digital experts, scientists, engineers and technologists. We operate globally from offices across the UK, US, Europe, and the Nordics.

PA. Bringing Ingenuity to Life.

Inclusion & Diversity


We believe that diversity makes us a stronger firm and look to employ people with different ideas, styles and skillsets. This diversity stimulates a rich, creative environment – one in which our people develop, and our clients enjoy enduring results. We’re committed to recruiting, promoting and rewarding our people solely based on their ability to contribute to PA’s goals, without regard to their sex, race, disability, religion, national origin, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age or marital status.

We welcome international applications, but we are unable to offer sponsorship for work permits, so you will need to have the full right to live and work in the UK. Unfortunately, your application will be automatically rejected if you do not have these rights.

Imagine introducing the next generation of technology to a platform in real-time


G-Research is a leading quantitative research and technology company. By using the latest scientific techniques, we produce world-beating predictive research and build advanced technology to analyse the world’s data.

We are developing the next generation of infrastructure that can effortlessly scale and flex. This capability allows us to adapt to the demanding needs of the business to process and analyse large and varied data sets at speed.

G-Research is a leading quantitative research and technology company. By using the latest scientific techniques, we produce world-beating predictive research and build advanced technology to analyse the world’s data.

Software Engineering is core to our business. By designing and implementing real-time systems, our engineers are solving some of the world’s most complex financial problems.

The role

Our Realtime Platform Development (RPD) Group are looking for exceptional software engineers to work alongside our world-class quantitative researchers to help us better predict the future. As part of this select group, you will be responsible for a wide range of projects under the direction of quants at the bleeding edge of research. Previous projects have included:
Applying novel machine learning ideas to our datasets using our in-house compute farm
Adding new features to open source machine learning packages
Extending trading platform capabilities to enable new research
Optimise performance critical parts of our trading platform
Applying numerical methods to compute solutions to quants’ mathematical models in a latency-sensitive environment
Refactoring quant code into high-quality software components with well-defined interfaces and appropriate testing
As an engineer working directly on research projects you’ll have the opportunity to see new research first and be expected to act as a conduit between research and engineering. This involves communicating quant feature requests with sufficient context to ensure engineering projects are triaged and scoped appropriately,l and acting as an ambassador for engineering whilst working alongside quants.

Who should apply?

In order to apply, you should be an outstanding software engineer, capable of solving a wide variety of technical challenges. You will need to be flexible and pragmatic; comfortable both rapidly prototyping ideas via throw-away code and developing high-quality well-tested components, able to add value through greenfield projects and improvements to legacy code alike.

Although day-to-day research work is often individual, it is always connected to a larger team effort. You must be effective working as part of a team of quants and engineers to improve our trading platform and the research we deploy to it.

The majority of our code is C# or F#, so familiarity with functional programming will be useful. This said, we prioritise the ability to learn whilst delivering value more than experience with any specific language or technology.

The successful candidate will be a software engineer with:
Excellent academics such as a 2.1 or better in Computer Science (or similar) from a top university, or as an alternative substantial and highly impressive professional experience
Demonstrable ability to engineer high-quality maintainable software and experience with automated testing and continuous delivery
Experience working closely with data scientists or quantitative researchers in a research directed environment
Experience with machine learning either professionally or from personal projects
Finance experience is useful but by no means a pre-requisite. Candidates from non-financial backgrounds are encouraged to apply.

Why should you apply?
Exposure to some of the world’s most foremost quant researchers, working on varied and challenging engineering projects
Highly competitive compensation plus annual discretionary bonus
Informal dress code and work/life balance
Comprehensive healthcare and life assurance
25 days holiday
9% pension contribution
Cycle-to-work scheme
Subsidised gym membership
Monthly company events
Central London office close to 5 stations and 6 tube lines

Position Type :

Full time

Type Of Hire :

Experienced (relevant combo of work and education)

Education Desired :

Bachelor of Computer Engineering

Travel Percentage :

0%
This is your chance to build and develop your skills in a fast moving environment where quality is at the forefront of our principles. We will support you to become proficient at building cloud based micro-services using test-first practices. Our objective is to grow you into a full-stack engineer that loves to solve new problems and thrive in an innovative and changing environment.
At FIS Merchant Services were pushing the boundaries of what it means to be a Software Engineer. This means you will be helping to shape the future of this practice along with the pace at which the industry is moving to make infrastructure a simple, resilient commodity to run our mission critical products.

About the team

Gateway 2.0 is a delivery organisation within FIS Merchant Services that builds a set of products for the Worldpay From FIS brand. We work directly with large corporate customers to help them integrate with our eCommerce Payment products. Our products are built using modern API standards distributed using modern cloud practices. This capability is a discriminator in the eCommernce Payments industry, thus is seen as a strategic initiative within FIS.

Our organisation operate a Tribe, Chapter and Squad system based on the Spotify Model. This facilitates cross-functional delivery with a core focus on delivering non-functional requirements and building quality in from the start. We care deeply about things like immutability, automation and agile ways of working.

More information on the Gateway 2.0 Tribe is available here: https://worldpay.github.io/gateway-tribe-principles

What you will be doing

As a Software Engineer you will be a member of a squad that is building, releasing and operating products for the Access Worldpay proposition. The Software Engineer role means that you take on technical responsibilities within the squad and the wider tribe. As a Software Engineer, you have a specialisation towards driving your squad forwards in all aspects associated with building micro-services. As a member of the squad you will also have deep understanding of the product and industry you are building for.

Specifically, you will be doing the following
Contributing to our tribes high-quality objectives
Pairing with your colleagues to deliver features
Helping to refine and plan the requirements for your squads products
Periodically being on-call for the services your squad builds
Developing your competencies with the support of your colleagues
What you bring:
An engineering skill set that is focused on quality and a test first philosophy, regardless of the activity
An agile mindset where you will drive both your squad and the wider tribe towards better ways of working
Experience of delivering Reactive Java Spring Boot based micro-services
An inquisitive personality that is always looking for constant improvement opportunities
Added bonus if you have:
Exposure to AWS, Docker and Kubernetes
Exposure to the Payments industry domain (especially Cards and other payment schemes)
Exposure to PCI-DSS
Exposure to SAFe
What we offer you
A multifaceted job with a high degree of responsibility and a broad spectrum of opportunities
The chance to work on some of the most challenging, relevant issues in financial services & technology
Time to support charities and give back in your community
Great work spaces with dedicated and motivated colleagues

Privacy Statement

FIS is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how FIS protects personal information online, please see the Online Privacy Notice.

Sourcing Model

Recruitment at FIS works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. FIS does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.
Competitors: Fiserv, First Data, Jack Henry & Associates

Job Description:
"Ocado Technology, powering the future of retail through sustained disruptive technology innovation..."


We're Ocado Technology. We architect and build the ground-breaking, game changing technology solutions that power Ocado, the world's largest online-only grocery retailer. We don't do off-the-shelf. We don't do easy. Because we're writing, building and running all our own software systems, we're constantly pushing the limits of what technology can do. And when we say 'we', we mean 'you'. Join us and you'll work across a phenomenal breadth of technology, with incredibly smart people, to create reliable, resilient, scalable and optimised systems.

And when we say 'pushing the limits of what technology can do' in the wireless team that means being at the forefront of wireless development. We may keep it quiet, but we have a number of systems that are the first of their kind and often the largest of their type.

We're now looking for Site Reliability Engineers to join us and accelerate that development. You will be joining a multinational and dynamic Wireless team located in Hatfield (UK). Instead of us relying on product manufacturers, you'll take responsibility for the ongoing performance of our systems and implementing improvements. This covers the full software stack, from server infrastructure running on Kubernetes down to embedded C code at the lowest levels of our wirelessly connected mobile estate. We use extensive monitoring and alerting tools to track performance and alert to us urgent issues before they impact our customers.

In this challenging role you will work across a spectrum of proprietary vendor systems and Open Source platforms ever mindful of skilling up those around you and driving knowledge sharing. Continually develop your own skills and the skills of those around you by working closely with your colleagues. Influence direction based upon the support requirements of the Operations Center of the emerging technologies that will be the production environments of Ocado's future.

What you will do...
Develop and maintain a thorough understanding of the system operation, right down to the lowest levels
Take ownership of the software stack installed upon a fleet(s) of wirelessly connected devices
Work with stakeholders in the operation to provide clear guidance and training
Share knowledge and up skill wider team
Adopt a 'continual improvement' methodology where automation is the centre of everything we do
Support the platform in a live enterprise environment
Maintaining the existing codebase. Writing and maintaining code and documentation.
We're passionate about people with...
Bachelor or Postgraduate degree in Wireless Communications, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or similar technical field.
Prior experience in a relevant role, e.g. SRE, DevOps, Systems Analyst
Comfortable in using a range of operating systems and CLI based interfaces e.g. Linux, Unix
Good understanding of common programming and scripting languages, e.g. Bash, C and Python
Understanding of wireless protocol stacks including TCP/IP and OSI models
Bonus points if you have...
Identify new approaches of problem solving and debugging skills to difficult problems
Able to share knowledge through formal and informal means
Familiar and comfortable with containerised hosting technologies such as Docker or Kubernetes
Proficient with Prometheus, Grafana and big data platforms such as Google BigQuery and Tableau
Able to manage their own time and schedule multiple tasks against business priorities
Technologies We Use
A Custom OFDMA IoT platform
WiFi, RFID and Remote sensor system in the 434 and 868MHz bands
Unix, Python, Bash and C/C++
Prometheus and Grafana
Git and a Continual Integration methodology
What we can offer you

Our employee benefits are designed for you, we care about people and we've ensured we have a wealth of benefits that focus on our your well-being. Within our flexible environment we can offer technically stretching work, a competitive salary and share schemes. Benefits include pension scheme, train season ticket loan (interest-free), free shuttle bus from Hatfield train station and of course, healthy Ocado retail staff discounts.

We also have regular divisional socials, sports clubs such as badminton, running and table tennis, not to mention the Ocado Technology Academy for a packed schedule of courses, conferences and events such as discussion sessions, conference briefs and external guest speakers. If you think you have what it takes to make a difference, please submit your application below.

Be bold, be unique, be brilliant, be you. We are looking for individuality and we value diversity above gender, sexual orientation, race, nationality, ethnicity, religion, age, disability or union participation. We are an equal opportunities employer and we are committed to treating all applicants and employees fairly and equally.

Due to the energising nature of Ocado's business, vacancy close dates, when stated, are indicative and may be subject to change so please apply as soon as possible to avoid disappointment.

#LI-KM1

About this Vacancy
Petroleum Experts is recruiting a development engineer with excellent software development skills.

+You will be part of a development and engineering team working on a product designed to guide the management of oil and gas fields using real-time data and physical models.

+Activities will include: software coding, interface design, database development and testing of the software tool kit in line with the product development plan.

+The company will support your personal development to allow you to deepen your knowledge of the corporate IT systems used for real-time oil and has management and optimsation.
Package
We offer an exceptional package which includes salary, performance related bonuses, other benefits and relocation assistance (where applicable). The company encourages and structures its salary based on personal performance and contribution to the success of others.
Qualifications
+ A good advanced degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Physical Science or Mathematics

+ Sound programming experience including: .Net, C#, Microsoft SQL server, WinForms, WPF

+ Additional experience of interest: OsiSoft PI, ArcGis, Cloud Computing, Microsoft Azure, Machine Learning and AI development experience, MVC Web Development

+ Comfortable operating in deadline driven environment

+ Excellent organisational skills, rigorous and attentive to detail
Company Information


Petroleum Experts is an industry leader in developing and delivering state of the art engineering software products and superior technical support to oil and gas industry. We have an impressive, broad range of clients worldwide, including all major operators as well as service and contract companies. We operate globally from our head office in Edinburgh, Scotland and US offices in Houston and Lafayette.

At AstraZeneca, patients are at the heart of everything we do

.

A global company that pushes the boundaries of science, we all share a big purpose: to discover and develop life-changing medicines that save lives.

Our role is to keep the business productive. Bringing together technology and service, with efficiency and security we drive the effective use of tools, processes and ways of working. A unique combination of reliability, and proactivity and collaboration. Always maintaining our global standards, whilst seeking opportunities for improvement across all our infrastructure.

The End User Services function provides IT Services for the entire AZ organisation. The function is truly global in scale with team members across Asia, Europe and the Americas

We currently have an exciting opportunity for an AskIT & Onsite Engineer to join us out of our site either in Macclesfield, Alderley Park or Speke? You will report to the Onsite Team Lead within a matrix organization aligning to local Campus IT Management. There will be flexibility needed for this role to travel between these three sites.

Role Focus & Challenge

As the AskIT Engineer you will be responsible for the end user experience and delivery of end user IT services this role will perform the day-to-day onsite IT activities so that Customer Effectiveness1 and Campus IT2 objectives are met.

You accountable for ensuring the effective delivery of Corporate IT EUS (End User Services3) services to our global customers through the Global AskIT service (an enhanced end user support service on key sites Tech/Genius Bar) and the effective delivery of deskside support services.

This role involves delivering various tasks such as incident and/or demand management, AskIT (including customer service), process alignment, service improvements and satisfaction measures, Asset management and stock inventory of any IT equipment on site to support Joiners, Movers and Leavers processes.

Key Responsibilities
Perform 1st & 2nd line deskside support for the customers device. Use troubleshooting skills and knowledge to determine the root cause of a fault to resolve or re-assign to the correct team
Analyze customer needs using their analytical skills to develop appropriate and innovative solutions as needed.
Collaborate closely with other IT teams as needed to resolve incidents / issues / queries, keeping the user advised of upcoming steps
Ensure that customer concerns are handled, managed and minimized while maintaining calm in conflict situations.
Support the local IT processes of incoming and outgoing staff to help them in a successful IT experience.
Demonstrate excellent customer service skills and a desire to support end users face to face
Perform a variety of technical work activities either remotely or at Deskside to meet business and customer requirements
Support IT drop in clinics and assist with floor walks when required.
Perform IMAC6 activities
Document and report on work completed within the Service Management tool ServiceNow7. Creating and updating tickets for all assistance provided
Act in accordance with company Information Security Policies and report any potential or actual Security events or other Security risks to the organisation
Keep skills up to date with IT industry standards as appropriate to the role
Provides improved Support where required for identified VIPs / priority customers
The wearing of garments with the AskIT logo in a professional way represents the AskIT brand and the One-IT experience.
What we are looking for?
You will have experience of working in an ITIL and Lean focused environment
Demonstrable ability to successfully interact face to face with end users
Confirmed knowledge and expertise within a Microsoft Windows environment (ideally within an enterprise domain business model) including familiarity with Active Directory, software development technologies 9SMS, SCCM, etc.) Group Policy Objects and remote -control methods.
Proven knowledge and expertise in supporting Apple Mac OS and iOS software desirable

Experience in the use of cloud-based storage solutions such as MS OneDrive and Box
Experience in MS Teams, Zoom and other collaboration tools
Knowledge of antivirus software within an enterprise environment
Ability to work in a customer-oriented support role manning a customer drop-in desk in addition to performing floor walking to extend support right to the customers workspace
Proven desktop support knowledge and expertise specifically for IT services (e.g. LAN / Wi-Fi, printing)
Demonstrable ability to successfully interact with other specialists in other proficiencies (e.g. application support, network team, server admin, etc.)
Knowledge and experience of ServiceNow or another ITSM tool is desirable
AstraZeneca is a place to innovate, take ownership and run with it with countless opportunities to learn and grow your career. You get to craft your path, but theres support all the way. If this sounds of interest... we would love to hear from you!

Job Title: Senior IBM Sterling/Java Engineer Order Management
Job Description:
20000TWS)
We are a technology focused retailer hiring senior developers at our London Tech Hub.

You will be working on the IBM Sterling OMS migration project, implementing the order management and notification micro service journeys within Argos backend services.

It’s an exciting opportunity to join a growing team in the process of migrating to the latest version of IBM’s Sterling OMS, reengineering the way in which we transform data related to Argos orders and re-architecting the notification system for the SainsburysArgos group. We’re building exciting new features that we can test and release at pace, delighting our customers and helping to take digital at Argos to another level.

Typical Technologies in our stack for this role:
We use Java 8/11, Spring Boot, Microservices Architecture and Kafka. We connect with back-end microservices architecture running on a mixture of AWS and on-premise, deployed to Mesos/Marathon Dynamodb, Jenkins, Docker. We write our own performance scripts using JMeter and monitoring via DataDog. We keep track of everything using Git, Jira & Confluence and use the full SCRUM cycle with stand-ups, planning poker, burndowns, demo’s, retros, sprint planning and empowered teamwork!

Argos tech teams are encouraged to explore and adopt new technologies to solve the challenges they face. Are you ready to join our next stand-up?

Challenges we’re excited about tackling:
The IBM Sterling migration programme and developing order management microservices within Argos requires integrating with many systems like Payment, Checkout, Promotion service etc. The candidate will have a chance to sit down with all the other teams and be involved in design discussions, apply BDD using API Level testing frameworks. The role requires interaction with Product Managers and technical teams from across the Sainsburys group. So, it requires technical and communication skills, not just sitting and coding all the time. Therefore, we are looking for candidates that are open to discussions, has experience on integration projects.

We are looking for people with:
Required:
Expertise in design/application development with IBM (Sterling) Order Management Fulfilment Suite with a minimum of 4 years of experience
Implementation Experience in Sterling order management with versions greater than 9.0 is preferred
Advanced Java 8/11 knowledge including frameworks like Spring
Kafka 1.0/2.0
Experience on working on microservices architectures
Working familiarity with and preference for modern software design patterns
BDD automation (i.e. Cucumber)
Rest/JSON API endpoints
Git Framework (we use GitLab)
Deployment tools and configure pipelines
Containerised build and deploy using Docker
Agile Methodology
Proven experience of technical leadership and mentoring
Demonstrates initiative-taking and striving for continuous improvement
Familiar with new technologies and know where it’s appropriate to use them
Hands-on experience with Cloud infrastructure and services, preferably with a good understanding of AWS
Nice to have:
Python
Dynamodb/NoSQL databases
An eye for great customer service and delivery
Has worked on Integration projects before
Good communication skills
Primary Location GB-London
Work Locations Argos - Origin Sainsbury's Argos 129 Wilton Road London SW1V 1JZ

Do you see yourself as one of those “out-of-the-box thinkers”, “Technical masterminds”, “Outstanding creatives”, or “Mind-boggling number crunchers”? If so, we want to welcome you to the Betway family and celebrate what makes you unique!

Our global customer base is exploding and we need your skills to support us on this exciting journey! Don’t look back and submit your application before the opportunity passes you by..

The Department:

Due to Covid-19, this role is currently on hold. However, we are still taking applicants for when we are back to normality.

The IT department encompasses several key areas, facilitation of millions of sports bets, to bespoke promotion engines and comprehensive CRM solutions. We're technology and business agnostic and ensure, with the right hardware/software and freedom, we can always improve the quality of our applications so everything is possible!

Meet your future team:

The CRM team is a group of motivated, technically skilled individuals creating a Microsoft Dynamics 365 solution for almost 1000 internal users to manage customers data.
We take pride in what we create and take ownership of the solution from end to end.

Our mission:
We only got one: make sure our customer are happy, compliant and secured when they need us to manage their data. We try to ingrained this mission in everything we build.

As a QA Engineer you will help contribute to this focus on a daily basis. Make sure high standard quality is ingrained into the team. Bring your experience and help us go to the next level so our users can help our customer in the best way.

Are you up for the challenge?

You will be responsible for:

To help your team to succeed we count on you to:
It starts with you - Bring your CRM QA experience to offer a better way of testing and share your knowledge with the team.
Quality from the start - Get involved in the user story definition process and write test scenarios upfront.
Embrace technology – Create automate test to ensure quality in a fastest way
Be the evil tester - Work close with developers/product owners to ensure that quality is taken into account.
Ensure that bugs are treated with importance and try to limit the amount that make it live.
What you will get from us:
Opportunity to improve your CRM Dynamic / Microsoft skills from certified people with several years of experience
Opportunity to move across different projects if you want to.
Easy-going team atmosphere, we work efficiently and like to have fun (everyone can contribute).
Very approachable people: it's better to learn this way.
Very good team synergy, if you're a team player you will like it!
You will have:
Full understanding of testing web applications, websites and associated technologies.
Demonstrable experience in testing with Microsoft Dynamics 2015 or newer.
Ability to communicate well with stakeholders, team members and manager.
Experience with test automation tools and strategies.
Good understanding of C#/Java.
Selenium WebDriver (not IDE) experience.
It would be a bonus if you also had:
Demonstrable experience in source control systems.
Knowledge of EasyRepro UI framework.
Knowledge of solution management/deployment under MS Dynamics
Willingness to learn new skills that are not under "common" QA tasks
Person specification:
Everything is possible – We love and value a can-do attitude.
Growth mindset - Conference, meetup or reading: nothing is enough to increase our knowledge and open our mind.
Extreme ownership - You would love working with us if you think owning a mistake is only a path to improvement.
Share the thrill – You see a good activity to do: share it with your team, it's twice the fun! Bring your "you" to work.
Work like Sherlock Holmes - Have excellent attention to detail.
Our Perks:
1 day a week remote working option
Competitive package
Great social and charity events
Health and well being weeks
Free fruit and a heavily discounted Barista
Tickets to events via sponsorships etc
Season Ticket Loan

Job Description:
DevOps Engineer

Overview

We are currently seeking to hire a DevOps Engineer in our Belfast office. As a DevOps Engineer you will be working as part of the Product Engineering team. You will be driving forward our ability to build, deploy and release Cygilant products like SocVue. As such you will have technical ownership to ensure stability in our automated pipeline, be at the forefront of building and maintaining our release strategy, to ultimately deliver excellent quality products for our customers.

Primary Responsibilities
Hands-on managing of the pipeline and release strategy for the core Product suite
Managing releases throughout our various environments (Dev, QA, UAT, Production)
Liaising across teams like QA, Product Management and Security Operations to ensure all aspects of CI/CD are implemented
Education and Experience
3 plus years' experience in DevOps, Infrastructure and/or Software Engineering
BA or MSc degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or other software related discipline, or commensurate industry experience.
Required Skills
Strong experience with AWS
Experience with Infrastructure as Code (IAC)
Strong analytical and communication skills
Strong experience with SCM (git)
Experience with Docker and working with containers
Desired Skills and Competencies
Experience with Relational and NoSQL database systems (PostgreSQL, MariaDB, Cassandra, MongoDB)
Experience in scripting (bash, python)
Experience with messaging and stream protocols (like Kafka)
Experience with high-availability and load balancing
Experience with Microservice architecture
Experience in programming (Java, Javascript)
Experience in working in various agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban)
This role will require an element of flexibility around working hours and 'on call' hours to manage ad-hoc environment issues.

Company Overview

At Cygilant we believe that every organization, regardless of size, deserves an enterprise-class cybersecurity program. We are passionate about delivering affordable, best-of-breed hybrid security-as-a-service solutions to continuously protect our customers. Cygilant is a trusted security advisor to organizations that need to improve their IT security and compliance posture and protect against cyber threats and vulnerabilities. Acting as an extension of our customers IT teams, Cygilant provides continuous security operations based on best-of-breed technology at a fraction of the cost of alternative solutions.

Want to join a team with a mission to improve and save lives?


We continually look for motivated and skilled individuals who are interested in supporting our customers – healthcare professionals who use our products to help patients and their communities.

We currently have the following opportunity available - please contact us for more details!

Elekta is proud to be the leading innovator of equipment and software used to improve, prolong and save the lives of people with cancer and brain disorders. Our advanced, effective solutions are created in collaboration with customers, and more than 6,000 hospitals worldwide rely on Elekta technology. Our treatment solutions and oncology informatics portfolios are designed to enhance the delivery of radiation therapy, radiosurgery and brachytherapy, and to drive cost efficiency in clinical workflows. Elekta employs 3,600 people around the world. Headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, Elekta is listed on NASDAQ Stockholm. www.elekta.com.

We have Senior and Developer roles across the full range of ‘full stack’. Whether you prefer to focus on front-end or enjoy a deep dive into DevOps or something in between, we’re interested.

We’re looking for people who know how to learn and how to think, we don’t require experience with any particular part of our stack. Our stack is also evolving. We’re early adopters of any technology that can help use deliver our product and we’re not afraid to change and to upskill the entire team in a new area. Currently we use: -

Front end: Angular, React, JavaScript. HTML5, CSS3

Back end: .NET Platform (C#, .NET Core), Microservices, REST APIs (openAPI, Swagger), MS SQL Node, Rabbit MQ, Kafka

Infrastructure: Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, gRPC, VMware, Azure DevOps, CI/CD, Sonarqube

Familiarity with various design patterns such as Domain Driven Design, CQRS and Event Sourcing

Expertise in these would be advantageous: Python, GoLang, TypeScript and ServiceMesh, Medical Devices.

Our Technology team is 15 people and counting. It’s a strong team, weighted towards Lead and Senior developers. Working here means working with peers who each bring different strengths and experiences. We use SAFe methodology and put CI/CD and automated testing at the heart of delivery and have demonstrable experience in delivering multiple software updates daily.
Location: Crawley, West Sussex, South East England, England

Job Description:
This role will be within the Virtual Integration of Testing Automation Lab (VITAL) team. VITAL is based on Hardware-in-the-loop (HIL) testing environment and used to support embedded software validation testing at full vehicle system level (Level 5). Key Responsibilities: Co-ordinate full vehicle HIL Simulink modelling activity to support current and future vehicle program testing. Support the integration of powertrain and chassis models into VITAL platforms.

Identify future HIL simulation capability (e.g. test automation) and work with the HILST Team Leader to develop and deploy new technology. Support test engineer/ECU owner test requirement and develop related HIL capability to conduct the test robustly. Significant experience in hardware-in-the-loop simulation and test (HILST) using dSPACE and Mathworks products such as Simulink, Stateflow, Real-time Workshop and control desk.

Experience in resolving ECU software issue using HIL test rig. Good understanding of Vehicle electrical infrastructure (e.g. vehicle diagnostics, vehicle CAN/LIN/FlexRay network and specialised knowledge on some individual ECUs in the vehicle).

Software Engineer – Real Time Control Systems Software for Medical Devices

Help patients get life-saving treatment, as a Real Time Software Engineer joining a talented team of engineers developing medical device control software for our world leading Radiation Therapy Treatment systems. We are looking for a hands-on developer who is also focused on continuous technical improvement.

At Elekta we believe patients should have access to – and benefit from – precise, personalised radiation therapy. Elekta’s Precision Radiation Medicine is revolutionizing cancer care. Bringing together science, technology and clinical intelligence, we’re working towards a future where everyone who needs it can benefit from precise and individually tailored radiotherapy treatments. We’re giving millions of patients the chance to live more moments that matter.

We are expanding the team working with Real Time Embedded C/C++ on the control system software for our cutting-edge Linear Accelerators. We encourage designing and developing of great solutions, getting hands on to diagnose issues and liaising with hardware engineers. A great team doing a great thing. Technologies includes C/C++ in Visual Studio and Eclipse running on a custom X86 architecture with a RTOS. Code quality is key in this safety critical product.

The role includes an excellent benefits package and is based in Crawley near to Gatwick airport, in our purpose built modern and spacious UK office with good transport links via rail, bus, and car.

Apply with a CV using our web portal, to join a great group of people, where your creativity is encouraged. It is a two-phase interview process consisting of an initial 30-minute call followed by a face to face (or video call) .

C/C++
RTOS

Windows based development

Job Description:
Our client is a community-based space platform that combines space and blockchain technologies to build the world’s first open-source blockchain-based satellite network, allowing users to develop and run decentralized applications in space.

Our client is looking for a Software Engineer to help construct, maintain, and troubleshoot our rapidly expanding infrastructure. During the development work, you will be learning the blockchain technology and constructing blockchain-based software. You will be part of a talented team of engineers demonstrating superb technical competency, delivering mission-critical infrastructure and ensuring the highest level of availability, performance and security. We require a background in computer science and computer system engineering who has strong interest in Blockchain/DLT technology.

Responsibilities:
Learn various blockchain protocols and DLT technology

Build and extend applications of blockchain protocols.

Manage and monitor all installed systems and infrastructure.

Install, configure, test and maintain operating systems, application software and

system management tools.

Ensure the system and infrastructure availability.

Monitor and test application performance for potential bottlenecks, identify possible

solutions and work with developers for implementation.

Maintain security, backup, and redundancy strategies.

Write and maintain custom scripts to increase system efficiency and lower the human

intervention time on any tasks.

Participate in the design of information and operational support systems.

Provide 2nd and 3rd level support.

Liaise with vendors and other IT personnel for problem resolution.

Skills and Experience:
We are looking for people who are passionate about software development and

blockchain technology, as well as have interest in the space industry. We are expecting the

candidate to take full ownership for their work and projects, and believe in a transparent and

collaborative culture with the goal of making it a success.

A college degree in a technical field. (BA/BS)

Software development experience

Proven working experience in installing, configuring and troubleshooting UNIX/Linux

based environments

Solid experience in the administration and performance tuning of application stacks.

(e.g.,Tomcat, Apache, NGINX, NodeJS, PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, Cassandra, ELK

etc)

Solid Cloud experience, preferably in AWS

Experience with virtualization and containerization. (e.g., Docker, Packer, Kubernetes,

Helm)

Experience with monitoring systems

Experience with automation software. (e.g., Puppet, Ansible, Chef)

Solid scripting skills. (e.g., shell scripts, Python)

Solid networking knowledge. (OSI network layers, TCP/IP)

The Role
You will be joining a team that designs and builds a range of services and systems providing the automation infrastructure for YouView set top boxes and televisions. As a software engineer in the Automation Infrastructure team, you will develop and maintain our in-house automation software, ensuring our platform is the best of its kind. You will be working as part of a team of highly skilled Python developers, building software and hardware from scratch, working closely with developers and testers in product teams to build quality automated test frameworks for YouView. We allow one working day every 2 weeks for personal development and project innovation, with additional training available when required.
In this role your responsibilities will be as follows:
· Building web services in Python (Flask, SQLAlchemy, PostgreSQL) and JavaScript (Vue.js)
· Raising detailed tickets in Jira considering product requirements and possible high-level design
· Build and maintenance of physical automation rig hardware
· Automated application deployment and scaling with Kubernetes
· Team collaboration via code review process
· Work closely with testers and other software engineers, advising them in the development of automated tests
· Work with key stakeholders across the business, including developers and managers to ensure automation frameworks meet their requirements
· Manage and improve the team’s continuous integration, software release and deployment processes
· Detect, investigate, and resolve hardware or CPU/storage/memory/network issues
· Evaluate and implement solutions to extend our test capability and improve the platform
We’re looking for someone with experience with some of the following:
Software development with Python. Ideally using a web framework (Flask/Django) and an SQL database backend (Postgres/MySQL)
Working in a team environment on a shared codebase
Desirable skills
Basic frontend skills (HTML/CSS/Javascript)
Linux administration and configuration (Ansible, Chef, Puppet)
Containerisation technologies (Docker, Kubernetes)
Understanding of software testing, television, and broadcast IP platforms

What we value and what we require from you:
Your background could be from many different types of domains, but we've found the most suitable candidates from digital content companies, consumer-facing platforms, start-ups, or anywhere that's building out novel, high performance, distributed architectures and systems.
You'll be a talented engineer keen to hone your skills and influence us to adopt new technologies, practices & services. YouView has ambitious plans for the future, and there are opportunities to develop and progress towards technical leadership positions.
Benefits:
• Competitive Salary on offer
• Annual Bonus
• London City location with easy access to Cannon Street & London Bridge
• Pension Plan
• Private Healthcare
• Flexible working
• Holiday purchase programme
• Season Ticket Loan
• Free Set Top Box
• Staff Discount Scheme
About us:
YouView launched in summer 2012, brought BT Sport over IP in 2013, an upgrade to 4k and the launch of Netflix in 2014, partnered with Sony to offer the UI for its TVs in 2015 and brought the first UHD device to the UK. YouView launched a major upgrade to its underlying platform in 2017 with an award winning UI in the UK with a powerful cloud back office providing new data and insights into how consumers watch and find TV. It recently announced the launch of Amazon Prime with BT and the arrival of Sky Atlantic in early 2019.
YouView continues to innovate and is working with the BBC to trial a UHD version of BBC iPlayer. YouView has won a number of major industry awards including Advanced TV Innovation of the Year at the 2017 Content Innovation Awards and Best Platform at the annual T3 Awards and most recently winner of the National Technology Awards for TV, Film and Broadcasting Technology of the Year.
Our Values:
We’re Smart
We hire the best and work as one. Informed by data but inspired by insight, we find brilliant new ways of making the complex simple
We’re Always Ahead
We are focused on the future continuously evolving and innovating to bring a better TV experience everyday
We’re on your side
Working with our partners and understanding their customers we shape the perfect TV experience around our viewers

Twitter,Linkedin& Glassdoor

About the team

Bulb is here to help our members cut their energy bills and reduce their carbon emissions. Our product teams make that happen. We’re developing products that will deliver the future of energy - from using AI to read energy meters, to making carbon offsetting fun and simple, from finding out how to get the most from Smart Meter data to helping people get paid for their solar energy. We also power the sign-up journey that helped us become the fastest growing company in the UK last year and the internal tools that let us deliver a an excellent Trust Pilot score.

The following pods are hiring Principal Engineers:

Experience

Covers member web and mobile apps as well as tooling that support our Energy Specialists to deliver #1 member experience. Experience in bringing productivity improvements for internal teams is very beneficial.

Requires genuine full-stack skills and experience, nice to see integrations with 3rd parties predominantly for helpdesk, telephony, chat.

Requirements

At Bulb we want to hire people with the experiences necessary to get going quickly, but who are also interested in learning new things and are comfortable working in a changing environment.
Expert level knowledge in multiple technologies
Work with CTO to define long term technical strategy, guidelines and principles, and align multiple teams spanning 20+ engineers across multiple pods
Take ownership for large projects stretching beyond quarterly planning ensuring successful delivery, but don’t shy away from harder tactical improvements
Identifies and plans strategic improvements across operation of multiple pods / organisation
Help us hire and onboard senior and specialist roles and support the growth of engineers across multiple pods.
Bootstraps new pods ensuring technical alignment at an early stage.
Tech Stack

At Bulb we use a wide variety of technologies. While we have core technologies that we work with, we're always trying to pick the best tool for the job, and are always looking at what's on the horizon.

Our stack currently includes, but is not limited to:
Node, Typescript, Koa, GraphQL React, React Native, Webpack, Babel
CircleCI, Kubernetes, Docker and Google Cloud Platform
Ideally, you would be familiar with these technologies or similar patterns; notably, Typescript/Javascript coupled with React is a core technology for us. But we’re more interested in your broad experience of software development than of specific tools or libraries. You should be comfortable getting up-to-speed quickly in new tools and platforms. You should be pragmatic and experienced enough to know when a different choice of technology would be more suitable, and comfortable leading explorations into new technologies.

Team Structure

Teams at Bulb are cross-functional, self-organized and autonomous pods. The key features of this structure are:
You’ll be working within a growing cross functional team composed of specialists with backgrounds in DevOps, Engineering and Security.
We practice Scrum/Kanban and work lean.
Work is not siloed, you’re able to commit across the stack, and you have a view of all the features the team are working on.
We use data to drive continuous improvement in our development process and we review this data in our fortnightly retrospectives.
Benefits
Be part of a growing technology startup and help shape the future of energy.
33 days holiday a year (including bank holidays) and the option to buy up to 5 more.
After a year at Bulb, you can take an additional month of unpaid leave to travel, work on personal projects or simply to recharge and reboot.
12 weeks of full pay for maternity, paternity or adoption leave.
Every team member has the option to buy shares in Bulb at a later date, at a discounted price. We all own a bit of Bulb.
Activities to improve your mental and physical well being including office yoga and meditation.
Private health care with Vitality
Pension plan with employer contributions, and a cycle to work scheme.

Clevermed ⭐
Clevermed create the UK's leading maternity and neonatal solutions. Enabling NHS staff to deliver high quality care to their patients.
We are also an international company with clients across the globe.
Our team make's a genuine difference in women and children’s healthcare.
We are looking for a motivated software engineers to join our Integration and Perinatal teams to help continue our mission.

Make a difference ��

You could be delivering solutions that actively improve the healthcare of patients worldwide, while working with a great team of people.

We foster a collaborative environment that encourages continual improvement with the ability to grow, learn new technologies and thrive. Located in Edinburgh city centre, with stunning views, you will be working with our great team in a friendly environment.

You will be involved in all stages of development from ideas and architecture through to deployment and support.

You would either be on the team delivering system integration and interfaces or on the perinatal team, developing desktop, iPad and web systems our cinical users.
With regular and frequent release cycles you will be delivering value directly to users.

C#, RabbitMQ, ASP.NET, .NET Core, Elasticsearch and MS SQL.
Azure services - As part of our migration to Azure you will have the opportunity to use the latest technology to deliver the best solutions.
Other technology used throughout the company includes Git, Xamarin (iOS & Android), HTML/CSS, React.JS, WinForms, etc.
As big fans of automation we love Azure DevOps & Octopus Deploy.

Who are we looking for? ��
Commercial experience as software engineer, including with .NET.
An understanding of software development and a modern engineering mindset.
The ability to work in a team with members from multiple disiplines.
Good communication skills and attention to detail.
A problem solver who takes pride in the quality of their work.
A pragmatist who can balance long and short terms goals.
Even better if you have: ��
Experience of agile environments and working practices.
An excitement of existing and new technologies coupled with the knowledge to use these to deliver the best solution.
Experience of FHIR, HL7 and other interoperability protocols or projects.
You want to make a difference in Woman and child healthcare
Benefits

Benefits package that includes:
32 days holiday per year (including bank holidays)
Flexible working - an environment and policy that supports and adapts to your lifestyle
Pension
Gym membership
Cycle to work scheme
Friday drinks - an informal catch up and wind down every Friday afternoon

Lead Software Engineer – Go (Golang)

Integrate is a rapidly growing, global, venture-backed enterprise SaaS business that helps B2B marketers grow revenue and reduce costs. We unify demand marketing channels into a single, powerful platform that help organizations achieve quantifiable business outcomes.

In April 2019, Integrate acquired London-based SaaS business, Akkroo. Now forming the Events product as part of the broader Integrate suite, Akkroo enables modern B2B marketers to solve the many challenges around event lead management.

We have a top-tier client list including IBM, PayPal, Dell, Salesforce, Cisco, etc. and have an exceptional working environment where you will work alongside innovative, dynamic and inspiring team members.

If you like solving challenges, value continuous professional growth and are motivated to join an entrepreneurial culture then we would love to hear from you!

Quick Hits:

· 9+ Years Old
· 250+ Employees
· $80M+ in Funding
· Enterprise Marketing Technology
· Acquired UK-based SaaS business Akkroo in April of 2019

With that exciting growth, we are looking to add a Lead Go (Golang) Software Engineer to lead the technical decisions on our service-based architecture.

*we cannot do sponsorship at this time

What You'll Do:
Lead technical design decisions on Go (Golang) based services
Participate in proposing updates to back-end service-based architecture
Ensure quality and automated test coverage of all Go (Golang) based services
Participate in designing and building RESTful and GraphQL based APIs
Manage code reviews to provide constructive feedback on code changes for team mates
Act as a Scrum Master and / or Technical Lead in an Agile team and participating in Scrum ceremonies
Facilitate Scrum ceremonies in conjunction with the Product team and provide reporting on Agile team metrics
Provide estimations for high level roadmap items as well as tasks within Agile sprints
Work in a fast-growing business environment, where a passion for self-improvement and personal growth is required
Participate in shared out-of-hours emergency on-call support on a rotation basis
What You Offer:
5+ years of Software Development experience, ideally in a SaaS (software-as-a-service) business
Relevant Computer Science / IT related qualifications.
Solid experience creating Go (Golang) based services in a service-based architecture
Solid knowledge of automated testing for Go based platforms including Unit testing, Integration Testing and Test-Driven Development
Familiar with Scrum and acting as a Scrum Master or Technical Lead in an Agile team.
Considerations for performance, security, scalability and code reusability in all design decisions
Good understanding of large-scale service-based architectures
Strong experience working with Linux based server environments
Experience with NoSQL databases like MongoDB and relational SQL databases like MySQL and MariaDB.
Experience designing and building RESTful or GraphQL based APIs.
A desire to contribute to building an incredible business as part of a small start-up like team
A passion for self-improvement and personal growth
Additional Desirable Skills:
2+ years as a team lead with line management responsibilities.
Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS), Kubernetes and/or Docker.
Experience building C# / PHP based services.
Familiarity with CircleCI or other CI/CD tools.
What’s on offer:

· A lot of places boast a great culture, but what’s going on here is really second to none (check out our Instagram for a sneak peek). You would join a vibrant, supporting and friendly team, who are laser focused on seeing results and making a real impact.
· We have a set of core values which define us and shape our tribe, if they resonate with you then we could be onto something.

You can also enjoy…

· Tech/work tools: We supply you with the best hardware so you can focus on the tasks at hand. We’ll hook you up with a MacBook on your first day, and we’ll sort out getting any additional hardware you need as you get settled.
· Social: You can enjoy monthly team lunches (we’ll get the bill), various fun events and a company which genuinely gets on well with each other.
· Holiday: 24 days Holiday!!

About Us


Menlo Security protects organizations against cyber-attacks by eliminating the threat of malware. Even with a 99.9% defence, devices are still getting infected and our solution is a cloud-based isolation platform which acts as a digital partition to provide users with clean, malware-free web content. We recently raised $75 million in Series-D funding and are backed by top industry investors. We support customers across various enterprises including Fortune 500 companies, leading financial services, and the Department of Defence.

Exciting things are happening at Menlo! We're looking to grow from 180 employees as we transition from a small start-up into the next phase of our journey, and we need talented people to help us get there. If you want to make a real impact, solve new challenges and take ownership of your career, we encourage you to apply and join our team!

This position can be located anywhere in the UK

About the team

Infrastructure Engineering is responsible for building and operating the Menlo infrastructure platform. Together we enable our customers to connect to the internet without compromise. Our environment spans 40+ data centers and provides internet services globally. We expect failure, build security in by design, create evolvable systems and enable multi-tenancy across the infrastructure. Automation is an absolute.

We are committed to getting it done properly, the first time.
Experience building and running a high-transactional, 24x7 production environment
Experience with cloud services; multiple data centers and public cloud (namely AWS)
Strong familiarity with systems engineering at scale and distributed computing
Extensive knowledge and experience with systems and software programming
Experience with Linux and Linux kernel internals; configuration and tuning
Experience with systems configuration management and CI automation
Expertise in the design and implementation of infrastructure observability; service performance, monitoring and load automation
Experience with networking, load balancing, caching, compression, application firewalling, proxy, SSL termination, systems and application security
Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or equivalent engineering experience
Why Menlo?

Our culture is collaborative, inclusive, and fun! We believe in open communication, supporting new ideas, and sharing a mutual mindset of what we're aiming to achieve together. There are also tremendous opportunities to take initiative, implement new ideas, and have a hand in building something great.

Benefits & Perks:
Competitive compensation
PMI
Pension (4% company contribution)
Life assurance
Fast-paced team-oriented environment
Flexible work hours and work from home opportunities
Be part of a company that is truly changing the security industry!
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

----------------------------------------------------------------

To All Agencies:

Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of Menlo Security outside of the Talent organization. Menlo Security's policy is to only accept resumes from agencies via Greenhouse (ATS). Agencies must have a valid services agreement executed and must have been assigned the specific requisition to which they submit resumes, by the Talent team. Any resume submitted outside of this process will be deemed the sole property of Menlo Security. In the event a candidate is submitted outside of this policy is hired, no fee or payment will be paid.

We need a technical expert who is up to date with the latest testing tools and frameworks with 5+ years of experience in test automation to build our automation capability. This role requires a solid blend of testing experience, software engineering and technical knowledge. You will work closely with our global engineering team, to design and implement our quality practices, take a hands-on approach to qualifying our application (Darwin™) releases with test frameworks and automated quality gates.

What will you be doing:
Defining, designing, communicating, and executing Thomsons’s quality vision & processes across our global engineering teams and Darwin releases.
Ensuring you and others continuously improve by proposing and then implementing new quality processes, designs and engineering practices that make your team more effective.
Tracking the progress you are making towards the wider goals of your team, and transparently communicate it to your team, architects, engineers, DevOps and management.
Setting the technical direction, by consulting with the team and architects, and considering all arguments.
Maintaining high standards of software quality within the team by establishing good practices and habits.
Providing guidance and insight on development techniques and methodologies.
Researching new technologies for the team.
Coaching, one to one mentoring, and developing team members.
Essential skills:
Experience
5+ years of experience in test automation, testing Distributed Systems and/or Software Development Kits.
Designing, building and implementing testing tools, automation frameworks and Quality processes.
Designing and developing systems for both high availability and scalability.
Working with continuous integration tools such as Jenkins.
Working closely with DevOps in establishing effective quality strategies which facilitates a quick feedback mechanism in a continuous deployment environment.
Automating for Angular and ASP.net applications.
Proven Ability in:
Computer Science and Object Oriented Programming fundamentals with proven problem-solving and debugging skills.
Agile development methodology along with full software development life cycle experience.
Developing effective quality strategies for extensible, scalable, maintainable, secure and high performing applications.
Proactive communication and cross group collaboration.
Solid skills:
C#
Selenium Webdriver
ASP.net
SQL Server
Visual Studio
Team Foundation Server (TFS)
Jenkins
Nice to have skills:
Angular
Javascript/Jasmine
Nodejs
Specflow
Protractor
Other experience in Continuous Integration Tools e.g. TeamCity
Education:
Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or a related field would be advantageous.
What can you expect from us:
We believe that a good working environment and happy people are key to success. So, here’s a snippet of what you can expect from your day to day working atmosphere:
Being part of a global, successful and fast growing company.
The opportunity to learn and innovate. Pluralsight - largest tech & creative training video library.
An open, fail-friendly and fun environment.
Thomsons fosters an environment in which good, evidence-based arguments are always listened to and discussed.
Generous benefits package.
What will we expect from you:
Our principles are at the core of how we operate. As a member of our team, you will need to demonstrate the following principles and make them a core part of how you work:
Responsible
Transparent
Fail friendly
Continuously improve
Take pride
Maximising potential
Being brilliant together
Challenging everything, delivering excellence

We are looking for a PINK person, with:
Agile development experience and full software development life cycle experience
At least 4 years of experience in software development (web and server side applications)
Service Oriented Architecture
Message queues and event-driven services
Continuous deployment strategies
Solid technical skills and experience with:
C#
LINQ
ASP.NET
MVC
HTML
CSS & Responsive Web Design
SQL Server
WCF
JQuery
Angular
JavaScript
Developing extensible, robust and efficient applications
Developing secure, scalable, maintainable and high performing applications
Would be a plus:
Previous experience in leading development teams
Line management, coaching and mentoring skills

What we offer:
A yearly budget and the opportunity to build your own flexible benefits package
Work as part of a geographically distributed team, with colleagues in UK and Singapore
Fast-paced, agile work environment and the opportunity to work with our impressive clients
